title: [Self-directed] Cognitive Load Management Strategies for Effective Information Delivery in Virtual Classroom Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in science and experience in developing educational content
context.additional_context: A course for in-service elementary teachers to learn effective design and delivery of science content in virtual classroom environments, combining flipped learning with pre-learning materials (traditional/non-traditional videos) and real-time simulation activities.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze cognitive load differences between traditional and non-traditional video formats and select context-appropriate content types
Learners can design information delivery strategies that achieve an 80% or higher information retention rate after three months
Learners can enhance practical instructional design skills by applying the flipped learning model in a simulation environment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
